title: 114_s278
content: The "Citizen Empowerment Act" may be cited as the official title. Part III of title 5, United States Code, is amended to include a new chapter 79A for services to members of the public. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" establishes procedures for in-person and telephonic interactions conducted by executive branch employees regarding possible violations of federal statutes or regulations. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" allows individuals to record audio of interactions with executive branch employees during enforcement actions, with the term 'State' defined broadly to include various regions within the United States. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" permits individuals to make audio recordings of interactions with executive agency employees at their own expense. Federal employees conducting interactions can also record with prior notice to the individual and provide a transcript upon request, with reimbursement required.
